title: LaLiga final day : How Real Madrid fans should remember me - Ancelotti
body_text:
Sport
LaLiga final day: How Real Madrid fans should remember me – Ancelotti
Outgoing Real Madrid manager, Carlo Ancelotti, has revealed how he wants the club’s fans should remember him.
Ancelotti is leaving Real Madrid to take charge of the national football team of Brazil.
The 65-year-old Italian will take charge of his last LaLiga game incharge of Real Madrid when they face Real Sociedad on the final day of the season on Saturday.
Speaking at his pre-match press conference ahead of Real Madrid’s clash with Real Sociedad on Saturday, Ancelotti said he wants Real Madrid fans to remember him as a good manager.
Ancelotti said: “How Real Madrid fans should remember me? A good manager.
“Time puts everyone in their place. I know special days are coming.
“I am very happy as to how I was treated,” he added.
Ancelotti is Real Madrid’s most successful manager in their history.
He won five Champions League trophies during his two-spell at Madrid.
